#summary Status of Hotwire distributions

= Status of Hotwire on Unix/Linux systems =

 * Fedora: You should be able to *yum install hotwire* on Fedora 8 (Fedora 7 version is older).
 * OpenSUSE: [http://packman.links2linux.de/package/hotwire PackMan]
 * Debian: [http://packages.debian.org/sid/hotwire sid package] (*apt-get install hotwire*)
 * Ubuntu: [http://packages.ubuntu.com/hardy/gnome/hotwire Hardy] - working on a Gutsy version
 * Mandriva: Cooker users can just install the `hotwire` package. 2007 Spring users need to [http://wiki.mandriva.com/en/Docs/Basic_tasks/Installing_and_removing_software#Advanced_use:_Backports_and_candidate_updates enable the /contrib/backports repository], then they can install the `hotwire` package.
 * Archlinux: The [http://aur.archlinux.org/packages.php?do_Details=1&ID=12103 package] lives in AUR, so you can `makepkg` it or just use Yaourt to install it.
 * Gentoo: [http://bugs.gentoo.org/show_bug.cgi?id=183519 ebuild bug] (someone please pick this up), see also [http://forums.gentoo.org/viewtopic-p-4517681.html?sid=35ecace13a7eb1d78eba6d94b098707a forum thread on sqlite3]
 * Other? If you've packaged Hotwire for another system (or need help doing so) let us know on the [http://groups.google.com/group/hotwire-shell discussion group]
